email.title: Weekly Digest
email.text:
Hi everyone!
Our committee has been busy preparing for IC Hack 19 but that definitely doesn't mean we'll let the term go by without any events! That's right - we have another bar night coming up this week! More details below.
email.heading: IC Hack 19 Volunteers
email.text:
If you didn't manage to get a ticket to IC Hack 19, you can still take part by volunteering on the day! It isn't easy making an event go smoothly for 400 attendees and every volunteer counts.
To volunteer, join the [DoCSoc Operations](https://www.facebook.com/groups/1509850436007222/members/) Facebook group and we'll post more instructions soon.
email.heading: Imperial Venture Catalyst Challenge
email.text:
The deadline for applications to the Imperial Venture Catalyst Challenge competition is on the 20th Jan. This year‚Äôs competition has an ¬£80K total prize fund as well as a dedicated AI, Software & Robotics track sponsored by Amazon Robotics.
The Venture Catalyst Challenge enables Imperial students and alumni, within three years of graduation, to develop an innovative idea for commercialisation. If you have created something as part of your coursework, have an idea that spins out of your research, or have a project you‚Äôve been messing around with on weekends, then the VCC is for you!
For more information, visit [this page](https://www.imperialenterpriselab.com/programmes/vcc/) for more details.
_Please note this programme is not run by DoCSoc._
email.heading: The New Year Bar Night

event.text:
Come celebrate the start of 2019 with us at the first bar night of the year! Everyone's welcome (even if you've given up on your New Year's Resolutions already üëÄ).
Drinks tokens will be given upon entry for FREE to DoCSoc members. Tokens are valid for both alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks.

email.text:
Facebook is launching their 3rd run of Hack-a-project!
This is a 5-week mentoring programme kicking off in February 2019, designed for 1st years of a three year degree and 2nd years of a fourth year degree, looking to apply for a Software Engineering internship with Facebook. Selected students will come to the Facebook office, once a week in the evening to learn about the whole development cycle and build a project as a team via a hackathon!
In addition, we will be sharing tips on ‚Äúhow to crush your coding interview‚Äù, and also do a mock interview with you, where feedback will be provided to help you improve.
Each session will also be catered, so come hungry (to learn and to eat!)
**If you are interested, please sign-up by following [this](https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__hackaproject2019.splashthat.com_&d=DwMF-g&c=5VD0RTtNlTh3ycd41b3MUw&r=4Ht1aWc8IssynPN9692iKw&m=3QnJFgqZ2ln3T1h10vEd1PXGLEETEPLoEWP_HRlZc9k&s=rGe1mlmZqLK51_y0Ld3_wzqoa2xekf0TsLzs_VBIJ2E&e=) link AND send your CV to LucyKemp@fb.com with the subject headline ‚ÄòHack-a-project ‚Äì applicant 2019‚Äô.**
**The deadline for applications is the 1st of Feb.**
